channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Furniture and rubbish chucked in area between Herbert Road, 3rd August
item.description:
People are chucking their furniture and other bulky items in the bushes between Herbert Road and the road running parallel where the church is. Herbert Road Terrace It is depressing having to see so much rubbish littered up and down the road and whole pieces of furniture including a babies bed mattress/ chairs and a wardrobe drawers etc There are also a few houses at the end of Herbert Road Terrace where every week the bins are over flowing with rubbish pouring out on to the road making it difficult for pedestrians with small children to walk past , I think these houses need an extra black lid bin as they are shared accommodation of multiple residency and clearly the bins are not sufficient for the amount of residents in the house The litter in the bushes has been there for months (the babies mattress over a year) the issue with the bins along the road is an ongoing issue up and down Herbert Road the rubbish is an issue weekly

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herbert Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox had been here for over a week, 3rd August
item.description:
I live in the high-rise opposite to the area, and I see the dead fox from my balcony. I reported to the staff of the corporate landowner, but no action has been taken for over a week now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arsenal Way, Plumstead, London

item.title: Ongoing Misuse of Black Bin, 3rd August
item.description:
It has become a recurring issue that members of the public are using our bin for their own personal waste. We frequently find discarded coffee cups, soft drink bottles, and food, often dumped without any bags, making it unsanitary and hard to clean.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunnock Mews, Hackney, London

item.title: Damaged tree at risk of falling, 3rd August
item.description:
I am writing to raise an urgent and serious safety concern regarding a large tree situated at the rear of Orchard Rise West, directly behind 939 East Rochester Way. As shown in the attached photograph, the tree has a severe vertical split down its trunk, which is a clear indication of internal structural failure. Given the extent of this damage, the tree is at real risk of collapsing at any moment. Should this occur, it would severely damage multiple residential properties, including 939, 937, 935, and 933 East Rochester Way. The potential for injury to residents or members of the public is extremely concerning, especially as we enter a period of unpredictable weather which could accelerate the tree’s failure. I strongly urge the council to arrange an immediate professional inspection and, if confirmed hazardous, take swift action to remove the tree without delay. This is a preventable risk that requires urgent intervention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 939, East Rochester Way, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
